column4: how can i set the root level to 2, i dont want to boot directly into the UI.

Ooops, "initdefault" entry.  Should be the first entry in teh file.  Set the second field.  However, you'll be disappointed to discover that the GUI is on level 2 in Ubuntu.  This means, you'll have to shift all the /etc/rc2.d entries over to rc3.d and so on.
you still asking about init levels?  Didn't you read my messages an hour ago?
